justification: Cervical lymphadenopathy, fever, and fatigue are classic symptoms.  Periungual desquamation can occur in the later stages.}, {diagnosis: Streptococcal pharyngitis (Strep throat)
justification: Cervical lymphadenopathy and fever are common. While less common, periungual desquamation can occur as a late complication.}, {diagnosis: Cytomegalovirus (CMV) infection
justification: Similar to EBV, CMV can cause fever, cervical lymphadenopathy, and sometimes periungual desquamation.}, {diagnosis: Cat scratch disease
justification: Caused by Bartonella bacteria, it typically presents with swollen lymph nodes near the scratch or bite, fever, and sometimes skin lesions.}, {diagnosis: Secondary syphilis

justification: Can cause a wide range of symptoms including fever, lymphadenopathy, and a rash that can affect the palms and soles (which can involve periungual desquamation).}, {diagnosis: Kawasaki disease (in children)

justification: Presents with fever, rash, conjunctivitis, swollen lymph nodes, and can lead to peeling skin, including periungual desquamation.}, {diagnosis: Drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms (DRESS syndrome)
justification: A severe drug reaction causing fever, rash, lymphadenopathy, and potentially affecting multiple organ systems.}, {diagnosis: Hand, foot, and mouth disease
justification: Primarily affects children and causes fever, sores in the mouth, and a rash on the hands and feet that can peel.}, {diagnosis: Measles

justification: A highly contagious viral infection characterized by fever, cough, runny nose, red eyes, and a rash that can spread to the whole body, sometimes leading to peeling skin.}, {diagnosis: Scarlet fever
justification: Caused by group A Streptococcus bacteria, it presents with fever, sore throat, a characteristic red rash, and can lead to peeling skin, including around the nails.}
